intro: Kigelkeia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa and are characterized by their woody stems and deciduous leaves. The leaves are often alternate and have a distinctive shape, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Kigelkeia species are known for their ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making them adaptable to harsh conditions. Some species are also valued for their ornamental qualities and are used in traditional medicine.
